entry.title: Tavush border village residents want their lands back from Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Tavush border village residents want their lands back from Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
Four years after the military clashes in the Tavush-Tovuz region of the Armenian-Azerbaijani border, there are renewed concerns in the northeastern part of Armenia regarding potential aggression from Azerbaijan. As efforts to reach a normalization deal continue to stall, Baku has demanded that Yerevan relinquish control of four out of eight villages, which were previously inhabited by Azerbaijanis but are located within the Republic of Armenia. Meanwhile, Armenia‚Äôs demands for the return of segments of lands belonging to 31 villages continue to be ignored.

üìç One of Armenia‚Äôs leading opposition figures called on the army to disobey any orders to withdraw from four border villages that Azerbaijan is demanding be ceded ‚Äúimmediately.‚Äù üìç Armenia‚Äôs Nikol Pashinyan and France‚Äôs Emmanuel Macron held their latest round of talks, aimed at further strengthening cooperation between their two countries. üìç Armenia‚Äôs top diplomat personally inaugurated the country‚Äôs new embassy in Uruguay, its third diplomatic mission in South America. üìç Also Watch: Mindful Leaders featuring Nadia Gortzounian https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x3Ek2qvkG_o üìç Also Read: Yerevan‚Äôs Shrinking Green Spaces https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/768847/yerevans-shrinking-green-spaces/

entry.title: Armenia remains committed to nuclear energy, prime minister says

media:group.media:title: Armenia remains committed to nuclear energy, prime minister says
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs prime minister will meet with the head of the European Union and the United States‚Äô top diplomat next month for first-of-their-kind three-way talks. üìç Armenia remains committed to nuclear power and continues to explore options to replace its current, Soviet-era plant, Nikol Pashinyan confirmed. üìç France‚Äôs prime minister called on Azerbaijan to withdraw from Armenia and accused Moscow of seeking to ‚Äúpunish‚Äù Yerevan for its accelerating turn to the West.

entry.title: The Armenian people have spoken ‚Äì what exactly did they say?

media:group.media:title: The Armenian people have spoken ‚Äì what exactly did they say?
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs episode of CivilNet‚Äôs Insights series, host Eric Hacopian breaks down the results of the latest public opinion polling in Armenia and explains what the findings mean for the country moving forward. He also provides a fresh update on the state of the country‚Äôs burgeoning tech sector and explains why Armenians are naturally positioned to ‚Äúoverperform in the most important industry in the world.‚Äù
